abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Emergency Recovery and Risk Management Project for Bolivia
            is to support the implementation of the National Plan for
            Sustainable Rehabilitation and Reconstruction (PRRES) and
            strengthen the disaster risk management institutional
            capacity at the national level. This is a level two
            restructuring. There are no changes in the Project
            Development Objective (PDO) description or the main results
            framework as the activities to be cancelled have been
            completed by the government and funded by other sources. The
            changes do not affect, alter, or trigger any additional
            safeguard policy. The project was signed on February 11,
            2008, and became effective on December 11, 2008. It has two
            components: first component is strengthening the national
            system for risk management, which has two subcomponents: (a)
            policy development for sustainable reconstruction and (b)
            institutional strengthening; and second component is
            rehabilitation and reconstruction works, which has three
            subcomponents: (a) execution of rehabilitation and
            reconstruction works, (b) accompanying technical supervision
            for the execution of the works, and (c) execution of small
            mitigation and rehabilitation works. This restructuring
            process (extension, reallocation of subcomponent proceeds,
            and closing of activities) will enable the Government of
            Bolivia (GoB) to complete the following activities: (a)
            completion of the Alp coma Watershed Study and Oruro Land
            Planning; (b) strengthening disaster risk management
            capacity; and (c) completion of civil works to reduce
            disaster vulnerability. All of the proposed changes have
            been incorporated into the project operations manual and
            endorsed by the project Executive Committee. The Bank
            provided comments to the operations manual on April 15, 2012
            and it is now waiting for the formal no objection request
            from the GoB.
